intro: Launaea gorgadensis, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has a rosette of fleshy, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in harsh environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy seeds dispersed by the wind. Launaea gorgadensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and healing properties.
